meanings.definition: A mass of snow, ice, and rocks falling rapidly down a mountainside.
meanings.sent1: The avalanche covered the entire mountain.
meanings.sent2: We heard a loud noise as the avalanche descended.
meanings.sent3: The avalanche of laundry waiting to be folded seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an avalanche, contagious and unstoppable.
meanings.sent5: The avalanche roared down the slope, a force of nature to be reckoned with.

meanings.definition: A sudden or overwhelming quantity or volume of something.
meanings.sent1: An avalanche of emails flooded my inbox.
meanings.sent2: The team faced an avalanche of work after the project deadline was moved up.
meanings.sent3: The avalanche of compliments made her blush.
meanings.sent4: Emotions hit her like an avalanche, unexpected and intense.
meanings.sent5: The avalanche of support from the community was heartwarming.
